item.title: Migrating to git.gay
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
A few weeks ago I realised that my funds in my linode account were running out and I didn't really wan to continue paying for it so I decided to move to a static site provider. After doing zero research and just going to the first thing that popped in my head I dedcided to move to git.gay, since I wanted to try something new :3.

I also rememebered that there was a section for automatically deploying to codeberg pages automatically with Zola, which allows you to push to a repo and have your site automatically built and pushed to the pages branch so it's automatically hosted.

For some reason I am either really stupid, can't read or the documentation is outdated (tbh probably a mixture of all 3), but the .woodpecker.yml just didn't work so I just learn't how to use the build system for forgejo and made my own, which just pushes to a repository called pages after building your site using Zola running in an Alpine linux container.

I'm also migrated some of my repos that where on sourcehut to git.gay so everything is in one neat place.

item.title: Site rewrite
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
After an afternoon of work I have completely migrated to a ssg called Zola!

I mainly did this since I never actually learnt how to use hugo and wanted to have some more controll on how my pages were generated ;3.

I also plan to add more sections to my site soon^tm and with zola it seemed a lot easier to do that! Thankfully it isn't too hard migrating content from hugo to zola so the hardest part was really just getting my head around how templates worked (since I just modified the css for the lukesmith hugo theme for my last site!).

Since I'm on holiday right now I have the time to set up my super secret page this week :3, so stay tuned!

item.title: The Kiev 30
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
The second love of my life

I got the Kiev 30 for Christmas last year and it was love at first sight.

Me and father dearest got into (and in his case back into) 16mm photography with a Minolta-16 P and he decided to gift me an hold Kiev 30 in pretty much mint condition.

The Kiev 30 is a pretty blatant copy of the original Minolta-16 although it has a single feature wich blows the Minolta-16 OUT OF THE WATER

Manual Focus

Althought this seems quite well ... the baisic feature which is taken for granted on almost every camera most of the sub-miniature cameras that Minolta produced do not have a manual focus (with the exception of the Minolta MG) whith most of the cameras having a fixed focus, and the original Minolta-16 not even focusing to infininity and requiring an expesive and now rare lense to be usable for lanscape photograpy.!

One of my favorite parts of the camera is the view finder as it quite litterall is just a piece of glass with no magnification just kinda placed at the front of the camera :3, so it just kinda serves mors of an asthetic purpose

item.title: Email
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
NEW EMAIL ADDRESS

After convincing my friend to add me to her email plan I have my own email domain :333. The email host is called migadu and it's the most wonderful thing I have ever had to interact with. The setup with clients like thunderbird are a breeze and the setup with the domain name took less than 5 minutes.

item.title: The Citroën Ami
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Disppintingly close to greateness

A while back now I got to test drive a Citroë Ami with my dad and I have some opinions on the experience.

Firstly it's CUTE in the looks the department with it being built like a hamster. The interior is laking in most modern luxuries such as a radio or speaker system, with the expectation of bringing your own entertainment. The Drive Reverse Parked and Neutral buttons in our model being placed on the left hand side of the driver seat making it a bit uncomfortable to change gear. All of this in my opinion would be great for a silly little two seater since it would be lovely for someone and a partner to zip around a city... If it was fast enough. The Ami only goes at a snails pace of 27 mph (45 km/h), this in the uk is UNACCEPTABLE as most residential areas are 30 and only rencently some small towns have moved to 20 mph. In my opinion is my main gripe with the car as you are a moving road hazard blocking road traffic if you even attempt to leave your town / city. The second issue is the price of the Ami since for the same price of the ami, you can buy a hybrid Fiat 500 which is a better car in every aspect compared to the ami.

It's quite sad that the ami is just slow since if it went even 35 or even 40 mph it could be useable on country roads.

item.title: Going vegeterian for a month
item.author: Unknown
item.description: During October I dedcided to have a little fun and change up my diet to see how life was as a vegeterian. I'd say im normaly not much of a meat eater when it comes to my normal diet, but I will admit it is quite nice every once and a while, therfore the change to vegeterianism didn't go too badly. The onething that did get me was the amount of quite unasuming things that actually have animal products e.g., gummy sweets such as Liquorice Allsorts (which I was quite disappointed that I couldn't eat :( ) The thing I found most surprising was that I started thinking more actively about what I was eating compared to before I started the "chalenge" (To be honest it was the best thing).
